message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The suspicious mass on mammography warrants further investigation with a core needle biopsy, which is the least invasive option and can provide a definitive diagnosis. A bone scan and CA 15-3 measurement are not indicated at this time, and mastectomy would be premature without confirmatory biopsy results.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. Mammography shows a suspicious mass and the most appropriate next step is to perform a core needle biopsy for definitive diagnosis. Bone scan and measurement of serum CA 15-3 are not necessary at this point. Mastectomy is a drastic measure and should not be the first choice of management without a confirmed diagnosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A core needle biopsy is the most appropriate next step in management for a suspicious breast mass in a patient. A bone scan is not necessary at this point, as there is no clinical indication of bone involvement. Measurement of serum CA 15-3 may be done in the future but is not the most appropriate next step. Mastectomy may be considered as a treatment option, but it is not the most appropriate next step in diagnosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The presence of a suspicious mass on mammography and a firm, nontender mass on examination call for further evaluation. Core needle biopsy is the most appropriate next step in management to determine if the mass is malignant or benign. Bone scan and measurement of serum CA 15–3 are not necessary at this point. Mastectomy may be considered as a treatment option after the diagnosis has been confirmed by biopsy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The suspicious mass needs to be biopsied, so a core needle biopsy is the most appropriate next step in management. Bone scan and serum CA 15-3 are not indicated at this point, and mastectomy is an extreme measure without a definitive diagnosis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a suspicious mass on mammography and a core needle biopsy is the most appropriate next step in management to confirm or rule out malignancy. Bone scan and serum CA 15-3 are not indicated at this stage. Mastectomy is a more invasive procedure and would not be appropriate without confirmation of malignancy.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient has a suspicious mass on mammography and the most appropriate next step is core needle biopsy to obtain tissue for histological analysis. Bone scan and measurement of serum CA 15-3 are not necessary at this point, and mastectomy may be necessary depending on the biopsy results.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A mammogram showing a suspicious mass requires further evaluation. Core needle biopsy is the most appropriate next step in management to confirm the diagnosis of breast cancer. Bone scan and measurement of serum CA 15-3 are typically performed after a breast cancer diagnosis has been confirmed. Mastectomy would only be considered after a confirmed diagnosis and further staging of the breast cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A core needle biopsy is the most appropriate next step in management because it will help confirm the diagnosis of breast cancer without the need for surgery. A bone scan and measurement of serum CA 15-3 are not indicated at this stage. Mastectomy is a radical option that is only considered if the biopsy confirms invasive breast cancer.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. A suspicious mass on mammography requires further evaluation with a core needle biopsy, which is less invasive and can confirm or rule out malignancy. Bone scan and measurement of serum CA 15-3 are not necessary at this point. Mastectomy is a definitive surgical option but should be considered only if malignancy is confirmed.
